summary: This document is a series of internal Bureau of Prisons memoranda from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing the response to an apparent suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019. The reports describe finding Epstein with a makeshift noose, rendering aid, and moving him to suicide watch. One memo includes Epstein's subsequent allegation that his cellmate tried to kill him and extort money.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found with a homemade orange rope/noose around his neck in his cell, in an apparent suicide attempt. He later alleged his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate (bunkie) who initially alerted officers to the incident. Epstein later accused him of trying to kill him and extort money.

connections.description: Epstein alleged that Tartaglione tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him, with threats of violence, for about a week.
They were housed together in cell 124 on the M tier of the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt at MCC
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade orange cloth/noose around his neck, unresponsive. Officers intervened, removed the noose, performed chest compressions, and transported him to a suicide watch unit.

events.title: Epstein Accuses Cellmate of Murder Attempt and Extortion
events.description: After being revived and placed on suicide watch, Epstein told an officer he believed his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, tried to kill him. He also stated Tartaglione had been trying to extort money from him for a week, threatening to beat him up.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (9-South), M Tier, Cell 124/205-124
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at approximately 1:27 AM on July 23, 2019, with a homemade orange noose around his neck, in an apparent suicide attempt.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was the one who initially alerted officers to the incident.
After being revived and placed on suicide watch, Epstein alleged that Tartaglione had tried to kill him and had been attempting to extort money from him with threats of violence for about a week.
Epstein stated he had not reported the threats to prison staff, only to his lawyer, because he believed staff would not report an assault due to the nature of his charges.
The incident was documented in multiple memoranda from various correctional officers and a material handler supervisor at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
